greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: E.g.f.: Sum_{n>=0} x*(n + x)^(n-1) * x^n/n!.
comment: a(n) is the total number of leaves in all labeled forests with n nodes. Cf. A055541. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Aug 22 2012
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..150
formula: E.g.f.: ( Sum_{n>=0} (n + x)^n * x^n/n! ) * (-x)/LambertW(-x). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 16 2018
E.g.f.: LambertW(-x) / ( -x * Sum_{n>=0} (n - x)^n * x^n/n! ). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 16 2018
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..floor(n/2)} C(n,k)*C(n-k-1,k-1)*(n-k)^(n-2*k)*k!. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 22 2012
example: Also, A(x) = W(x)^x where W(x) = LambertW(-x)/(-x) and begins:
maple: a:= n-> add(binomial(n, k)*binomial(n-k-1, k-1)*(n-k)^(n-2*k) *k!, k=0..n/2):
mathematica: Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[Exp[x t] , {x, 0, nn}], x]  (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Aug 22 2012 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 13 2011
